result.execSummary:
The defendant Tristan M Bennett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs + DNA Surcharge. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

No contact with victims.
Write letter of apology to each victim, must give to Agent first for review.

timeConds.notes: (conditional jail - STAYED - If needed, gives Agent option to put in jail prior to a revocation option and Agent would have to have the Court lift the stay to enforce the conditional jail)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tristan M Bennett

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
10:23 a.m. Defendant Tristan M Bennett in court with attorney Atty Halverson for Anne Renc. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases 15CM247 and 15CM157.
  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. I/S Sentence: 150 days jail, 18 mo Probation for both cases: Conditions: Pay costs + DNA surcharge. 40 hrs Community Service,   AODA & comply with treatment recommendations. Pay balance of restitution $20.00. No contact with victims. Write letter of apology to victims, must give to Agent first for review. If successful, expungement option for both cases.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: Guilty for both cases

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CM247 and 15CM157.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

ADA Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Halverson concurs to joint recommendation.  

BY THE COURT:****PROBATION**
15CM157:
W/H Sentence:
18 mo Probation: 
Conditions:
30 days conditional jail - stayed (If needed, gives Agent option to put in jail prior to a revocation option and Agent would have to have the Court lift the stay to enforce the conditional jail)
Pay costs + DNA surcharge. 
40 hrs Community Service,   
Pay balance of restitution $20.00. 
No contact with victims.
Write letter of apology to each victim, must give to Agent first for review. 
If successful, expungement option.

15CM247:
W/H Sentence:
18 mo Probation, concurrent: 
Conditions: 
30 days conditional jail - stayed (If needed, gives Agent option to put in jail prior to a revocation option and Agent would have to have the Court lift the stay to enforce the conditional jail)
Pay costs + DNA surcharge. Comply with same conditions
Expungement option.
$2,000 sig bond: No direct contact with Shopko store in Plover ,or Brent Beiderwein Kelly Lide, and Debra Yenter.

Defendant Tristan M Bennett in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint
Defendant waives reading of Criminal Complaint
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties
Court advises defendant of right to counsel and can contact Public Defender's office for representation.

Defendant would like to consult with an attorney
Defendant can contact Public Defender for Representation
Court orders defendant to see Public Defender today. 
Court enters P/NG 
BTC: $2,000 sig bond: No direct contact with Shopko store in Plover ,or Brent Beiderwein Kelly Lide, and Debra Yenter.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
